caption: My boyfriend and I decided to get our Valentine’s Day dinner here, and definitely didn’t regret it! The fettuccine alfredo was delicious, and the portion size of the parmesean fries was extremely generous for just $2.99 - it was a full pasta container’s worth. They also included a cute Valentine’s Day chocolate heart. Will definitely be ordering again!
Great little place, I've been grabbing a quick slice of pizza on occasion, delicious. Nice crew that's works there. I'm looking forward to trying a whole meal there.
The thin crust is not thin but the toppings were good. The staff was nice and I really wanted to like this place but this pizza was just not it.
I got a few slices (since they are reasonably priced) for lunch and they hit the spot. I would recommend giving them a try if you are in the area. The minestrone soup was also good.

I've walked by this place in the neighborhood a bunch and finally decided to try it. We got the thin crust pizza, but calling it thin crust is a misnomer... It wasn't bad, but also not great. Looking forward to trying the deep dish to see if it's better!
If you’re looking for a real European/Italian pizza, this is the local one. Also their asparagus salad is p e r f e c t.

I probably wouldn’t even know about this restaurant if it wasn’t in my neighborhood and I didn’t walk by it a few times. Ordered a Large Pepperoni Thin Crust Pizza and it was really good! It came with a complimentary salad which was a nice touch considering I was debating ordering a salad. Definitely will get it again!  Only con would be the website needs a little work. Had a difficult time finding the menu outside of the ‘order online’ page and when I attempted to order online it said the restaurant was closed. I ended up calling and was able to order that way.  It’s a really new place so they probably need a little bit of time to work out to kinks of website but the food is the important part and they got that figured out!
